Mr. Keith Salter, an English and Language Arts teacher at Cornerstone Jefferson-Douglass Academy, has created a fun and unique way to help his students showcase their writing assignments and build their public speaking skills in his classroom. "The idea came from the Coffee House scene," he told us. "Many coffee houses have 'Open Mic' Nights. That's where patrons are able to recite poetry, read special readings, or sing a song."

"We just finished reading Romeo and Juliet," he said. "They broke up into small groups to recreate a small scene from the play." Salter's students love sharing their writing assignments in an area that has a spotlight, a faux brick wall background and other decorative items.

Shown here: Students Lauren and Ivan
